question_text: What is the output of the following code? int x = 5; int y = ++x * 2; System.out.println(y);
Which of the following is a valid `main` method?
explanation: Only public static void main(String[] args) is valid

question_text: What is the output of: String s = "Hello"; s.concat(" World"); System.out.println(s);
explanation: String is immutable; concat does not modify original

question_text: What is the default value of a `boolean` variable in a class?
Which one is not a Java keyword?
explanation: Integer is a class, not a keyword

question_text: Which statement is true about Java arrays?
option_b: Arrays can store different data types
option_c: The size of an array must be specified at declaration

question_text: Which operator is used to perform a short-circuit AND?
Which of the following classes is immutable?
What is printed? int i = 10; int j = 5; int result = i++ + ++j; System.out.println(result);
What is the return type of the `main()` method?
Which keyword is used to inherit a class?
explanation: extends is used for class inheritance

question_text: Which access specifier allows access only within the same class?
explanation: private restricts access to the same class

question_text: Which of the following is not a primitive type?
explanation: String is a class, not a primitive

question_text: Which exception is thrown when dividing by zero?
explanation: ArithmeticException for integer division by zero

question_text: How do you declare an abstract method?
Which collection class maintains insertion order?
What is the size of a `char` in Java?
Which of the following is not allowed in a `switch` statement?
explanation: boolean is not supported in switch

question_text: Which interface must be implemented to create a thread?
explanation: Runnable is the standard way to implement a thread

question_text: Which method is used to get the length of a string in Java?
explanation: length() returns the number of characters

question_text: What will it print? int x = 10; System.out.println(x++ + ++x);
What will it print? boolean b = false; if (b = true) System.out.println("True");
explanation: Assignment inside if evaluates to true

question_text: What will it print? String s1 = "java"; String s2 = "java"; System.out.println(s1 == s2);
explanation: String literals are interned → same reference

question_text: What will it print? int x = 5; System.out.println((x > 2) ? (x < 4) ? 10 : 8 : 7);
explanation: x > 2 is true → x < 4 is false → result is 8

question_text: What will it print? int[] arr = {1, 2, 3}; for(int i = 0; i < arr.length; i++) { System.out.print(arr[i] + " "); }
explanation: Basic for loop over array prints 1 2 3

question_text: What will it print? String s = null; System.out.println(s + "world");
What will it print? String s1 = new String("OCA"); String s2 = "OCA"; System.out.println(s1 == s2);
What will it print? int x = 7; int y = 3; System.out.println(x % y);
What will it print? int x = 2; int y = 5; x *= y + 3; System.out.println(x);
What will it print? int[] arr = new int[2]; System.out.println(arr[0]);
explanation: Default value of int array element is 0

question_text: What will it print? String str = "abc"; str.toUpperCase(); System.out.println(str);
explanation: String is immutable; str remains unchanged

question_text: What will it print? int i = 0; do { System.out.print(i + " "); } while(i++ < 2);
What will it print? int x = 5; int y = 10; System.out.println(x > 2 && y < 15);
What will it print? String str = "Java"; System.out.println(str.charAt(2));
What will it print? int a = 10, b = 20; int max = (a > b) ? a : b; System.out.println(max);
What will it print? int x = 0; if(x) { System.out.println("Zero"); }
What will it print? byte b = 127; b++; System.out.println(b);
explanation: Overflow of byte wraps around to -128

question_text: What will it print? System.out.println(10 + 20 + "30");
What will it print? String a = "Hello"; String b = "Hel" + "lo"; System.out.println(a == b);
What will it print? final int x = 100; byte b = x; System.out.println(b);
explanation: final constant fits in byte; implicit cast allowed

question_text: What will it print? int[][] matrix = new int[2][]; matrix[0] = new int[3]; matrix[1] = new int[2]; System.out.println(matrix[0].length + matrix[1].length);
What will it print? int[] arr = {1, 2, 3}; System.out.println(arr[3]);
What will it print? int[] a = {1, 2, 3}; int[] b = a; b[0] = 10; System.out.println(a[0]);
explanation: Arrays are references, so a and b point to same array

question_text: What will it print? String[] names = new String[2]; System.out.println(names[0].length());
explanation: names[0] is null, so calling length() throws NPE

question_text: What will it print? int[] nums = new int[5]; nums[10] = 3;
explanation: Index 10 is out of bounds; exception caught

question_text: What will it print? int x = Integer.parseInt("abc");
explanation: 'abc' cannot be parsed as integer; throws NumberFormatException

question_text: What will it print? String[] vals = {"one", "two", "three"}; for(String s : vals) System.out.print(s + " ");
What will it print? int[][] grid = new int[1][2]; System.out.println(grid.length + " " + grid[0].length);
What will happen? int[] arr = new int[-2];
explanation: Negative array size throws runtime exception

question_text: What will it print? int x = 10 / 0;
explanation: Divide by zero throws ArithmeticException, caught and printed

question_text: What will it print? int[] data = {10, 20, 30}; for(int i = 0; i <= data.length; i++) System.out.print(data[i] + " ");
What will it print? String[][] text = new String[2][]; text[0] = new String[]{"A", "B"}; text[1] = new String[]{"C"}; System.out.println(text[1][0]);
What will it print? int[] nums = new int[0]; System.out.println(nums.length);
What will it print? String[] list = null; System.out.println(list[0]);
explanation: Accessing list[0] on null array throws NullPointerException

question_text: What will it print? throw new IllegalArgumentException("Bad input");
What will it print? int[] values = {1, 2, 3, 4}; for (int i = values.length - 1; i >= 0; i--) System.out.print(values[i] + " ");
What will it print? Integer.parseInt("10.5");
What will it print? Object[] obj = new String[2]; obj[0] = 10;
explanation: Storing Integer in String[] throws ArrayStoreException

question_text: What will it print? String[] arr = {"one", "two", "three"}; System.out.println(arr[arr.length]);
explanation: Index arr.length is out of bounds

question_text: What will it print? throw new Exception("Boom");
explanation: Exception caught in second catch block

question_text: What will it print? if (i = 5) { }
What will it print? int x; System.out.println(x);
What will it print? byte b = 10; b = b + 1;
explanation: b + 1 = int → must cast to byte

question_text: What will it print? long x = 10_000;
What will it print? String s1 = "Hello"; String s2 = new String("Hello"); System.out.println(s1 == s2);
What will it print? System.out.println("1" + 2 + 3);
What will it print? char c = 65; System.out.println(c);
What will it print? double d = 5 / 2; System.out.println(d);
explanation: 5/2 is integer division first → 2 → then widened

question_text: What will it print? System.out.println(10 + 20 + "30");
What will it print? int[] arr = new int[]{1, 2, 3}; System.out.println(arr.length());
What will it print? Object o = new int[]{1, 2, 3}; System.out.println(o instanceof Object);
What will it print? int a = 5; a += 3.5;
explanation: += with double → implicit cast not allowed without loss

question_text: What will it print? static int x = 10; int x = 20; System.out.println(x);
What will it print? int[] a = new int[3]; System.out.println(a[3]);
What will it print? final int x = 100; byte b = x; System.out.println(b);
explanation: final constant in byte range can be implicitly cast

question_text: What will it print? short s = 10; s = s * 5;
explanation: s * 5 promotes to int → must cast to short

question_text: What will it print? true ? "yes" : 10;
What will it print? for (System.out.print("A"); i < 1; i++) System.out.print("B"); System.out.print("C");
explanation: 'A' prints first from loop init, then loop body → 'B', then 'C'

question_text: What will it print? switch(x) { case 5: print("Five"); default: print("Default"); }
What will it print? String str = "null"; System.out.println(str == null);
explanation: "null" is a string literal, not null
